170355. Polish Legions

France — Not random

Conditions

  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Monarch Le Directoire is active
    • Monarch Napolйon Bonaparte is active
    • Monarch Napolйon Ier is active
  • The following must not occur:
    • Poland exists

Will happen within 360 days of January 2, 1795
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1810)

Description

After the disappearance of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, many Poles supported revolutionary France, and saw it as a force that would bring Poland back from oblivion. In 1797, General Jan Henryk Dombrowski created Polish military formations in Italy - the Polish Legions - in the hope that the participation of Poles in the fight against a common enemy would speed up the liberation of the country. He introduced a modern command system in the legions modeled on the French one, abolished corporal punishment, gave the opportunity to promote soldiers of non-gentry origin, ordered them to learn to read and write, and emphasized the Polish character of the formation. The number of legions for five years increased from 7,000 to 20,000-30,000 men. The French government was not convinced of the usefulness of the Poles, so first sent them to the north of Italy.

Actions

A. For common freedom!

  • +10000 infantry in a random province
  • +5000 infantry in the same province

B. Send them by satellites

  • +5 national manpower

Back to top

170100. For all nations in all times

France — Not random

Conditions

  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Event 3342 - The French Revolution for France has already occurred
    • Event 3779 - The French Revolution for France has already occurred
    • Event 3780 - King Louis' Constitutional Monarchy for France has already occurred
  • Innovativeness is at 4 or higher

Will happen within 30 days of April 8, 1795
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1800)

Description

On may 8, 1790, following a motion by Talleyrand, the National Assembly decided on the creation of a decimal system of measurement units that would keep stable, unvarying and simple. The first unit chosen was based on a pendulum beating a second. On March 30, 1791, after a proposal by the Acadйmie des Sciences, the Assembly finally chose that a metre would be a 1/10 000 000 of the distance between the north pole and the equator. On April 7, 1795 (18 Germinal year III) the Convention decreed that the new 'Republican Measures' were to be henceforth legal measures in France. The motto 'for all nations in all times' was adopted for the new system. This was the Decimal Metric System, which proved to be simple to use, and making measure transitions between different dimensions easier beyond compare. The metric system has survived practically unchanged as the basis of today's International System of Units.

Actions

A. Adopt the Decimal Metric System

  • Infrastructure tech investment: +250
  • Trade tech investment: +200
  • Stability -1
  • +10 victory points

B. Bah, the old units are good enough

  • -10 victory points

Back to top

170098. The Directory

France — Not random

Conditions

  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Event 3342 - The French Revolution for France has already occurred
    • All of the following must occur:
      • The following must not occur:
        • Innovativeness is at 6 or higher
      • Event 3779 - The French Revolution for France has already occurred
  • The following must not occur:
    • Event 12121 - Robespierre and the Reign of Terror for France has already occurred

Will happen within 10 days of October 5, 1795
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after October 9, 1799)
unless prevented by
Action A of 3781 - The Directory for France

Description

The Directory was the French revolutionary government set up by the Constitution of the Year III, which lasted four years, from November 1795 to November 1799. The Directors chose governmental ministers, ambassadors, army generals, tax collectors, and other officials. However, they had no funds to finance their projects or courts to enforce their will. The Directory was perhaps the most corrupt regime that France has ever known. Its policies were aimed, first, at protecting and increasing the profits of those in political and economic power and, second, at preventing the return of the Bourbons or the establishment of any other regime that might endanger those in power by such means as the redistribution of national property. The period was also noted for extravagant fashions in dress, excesses in entertainment, and a loose morality.

Actions

A. A Coup d'Etat has brought Order

  • Monarch Le Directoire becomes active
  • Monarch La Convention Nationale will never rule
  • Centralization +1
  • Offensive Doctrine +2
  • Land +2
  • Stability +2
  • Ile de France revolts
  • Event 3781 - The Directory for France will never fire

Back to top

3781. The Directory

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 12121 - Robespierre and the Reign of Terror for France has already occurred

Will happen on October 5, 1795
unless prevented by
Action A of 170098 - The Directory for France

Description

The Directory was the French revolutionary government set up by the Constitution of the Year III, which lasted four years, from November 1795 to November 1799. The Directors chose governmental ministers, ambassadors, army generals, tax collectors, and other officials. However, they had no funds to finance their projects or courts to enforce their will. The Directory was perhaps the most corrupt regime that France has ever known. Its policies were aimed, first, at protecting and increasing the profits of those in political and economic power and, second, at preventing the return of the Bourbons or the establishment of any other regime that might endanger those in power by such means as the redistribution of national property. The period was also noted for extravagant fashions in dress, excesses in entertainment, and a loose morality. However, the most important aspect of the directory and what gave it legitimacy in the eyes of the people, even as it was corrupt, was that it had ended the Reign of Terror. Anything was judged better then the 'Today you, Tomorrow me' logic of the Terror.

Actions

A. A Coup d'Etat has brought Order

  • Monarch Le Directoire becomes active
  • Monarch La Convention Nationale will never rule
  • Centralization +3
  • Aristocracy +1
  • Innovativeness +4
  • Serfdom +2
  • Offensive Doctrine +1
  • Quality +1
  • Stability +2
  • Ile de France revolts
  • Event 170098 - The Directory for France will never fire

Back to top

170099. The Pacification of the Vendйe

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 170097 - The Counter-revolution for France has already occurred
  • The following must not occur:
    • Monarch La Convention Nationale is active

Will happen within 30 days of July 3, 1796
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

Since March 1793 those spontaneous and uncoordinated riots of peasants in Vendйe, also supported by local nobles and refractory priests, organized themselves in a 'Royal and Catholic Army' against which the inadequately equipped Republican forces were being easily routed. The Convention took measures against the emigrйs and the refractory priests and on 19 March 1793 it was decreed that every person accused of taking part in the counter-revolutionary revolts, or of wearing the white cockade was to be declared as an outlaw and commissions were sent to where the municipalities needed to be purged. But these measures proved to be insufficient as the successes of the Vendeans, coordinated with the Chouans, still continued in the 'bocages', whose knowledge gave the local rebels immense advantage. The defeats sustained by the Vandйans at Cholet and Savenay put definitely at end the regular warfare but not the massacres upon the civilians which were perpetrated by the republican forces in the rebelling departments. From January to July 1794 'Infernal columns' were formed and sent into Vendйe under the command of Tourreau with the Directory's formal order to 'exterminate this rebellious race of Vendйans, to make their abodes disappear, to torch their forests, to cut their crops'. Things went better after the changes of 9 Thermidor when the Convention allowed liberty of worship to the Vendeans and limitations to their conscriptions. In July 1795 a new 'emigrйs' expedition was attempted in the landing at Quiberon with the support of Chouans and of some remnants of Vendйan troops, however it ended in complete failure with the death of the last two 'White' chiefs. Only after July 1796 the 'troubles in the West were definitively appeased' and the state of siege was eventually lifted. It was esteemed that in 1793-1796 at least about 120,000 out of a population of around 815,000 died in the 'genocide' of the Vendйens.

Actions

A. No more troubles in the West...

  • Stability +3
  • -9000 population in Saintonge
  • -1500 population in Bretagne
  • -3000 population in Penthievre
  • -1500 population in Maine
  • Revolt risk value in Saintonge -12
  • Revolt risk value in Bretagne -4
  • Revolt risk value in Penthievre -8
  • Revolt risk value in Maine -4
  • Monarch's administrative skill +2 for 24 months

Back to top

France — Not random

Conditions

    • Event 3148 - The 18 Brumaire for France has already occurred
  • The following must not occur:
    • Italy exists
  • Own Lombardia
  • Own Mantova
  • Own Ferrara

Will happen within 30 days of October 27, 1796
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 1, 1805)

Description

When General Bonaparte managed to invade Northern Italy, it was his personal design to give a republican form of government to those Italian populations which were set free from their rulers and warmly welcomed the French invading troops. The Italian patriots provided a flag too, the French tricolore substituting the blue with the green. The Directory, who firstly opposed this decision and urged a march to Rome to dethrone the Pope, soon forgot Napolйon's disobedience well compensated with huge amounts of money and every sort of luxury goods looted by the French troops during the campaign in Italy.

Actions

  • Event 297013 - The Kingdom of Italy threatens the balance for Tuscany will never fire
  • Event 326000 - The Kingdom of Italy threatens the balance for Venice will never fire

170024. The Treaty of Campoformio

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Country has at least 25 non-colonial provinces
  • Event 170127 - The military expedition in Italy for France has already occurred
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Own Venesia
    • Austria owns Venesia
  • The following must not occur:
    • France and Austria are at war
  • Austria exists

Will happen within 20 days of October 18, 1797
Checked again every 20 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 1, 1805)
unless prevented by
Action B of 170127 - The military expedition in Italy for France

Description

The treaty of Campoformio signed between France and Austria stated that Austria would enter in possession of the territories of the Republic of Venice, while the Lombardy, large part of the Emilia and Romagna and the territories of the Cispadane Republic were united in the Cisalpine Republic. France was also recognized her rights of ownership over the Low Countries and the Left Rhine Bank.

Actions

A. Belgium for Venice

  • Cede Venesia to Austria
  • Cede Istria to Austria
  • Cede Friuli to Austria
  • Cede Verona to Austria
  • Cede Dalmazia to Austria
  • Cede Ragusa to Austria
  • Event 179022 - The Peace of Campoformio for Austria is triggered immediately
  • Event 193801 - The Betrayal of Napolйon for Italy is triggered immediately

B. We are not merchants

  • -50 relations with Austria
  • +50 relations with Italy

170265. La Croceta

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Corsica
  • Corsica is a national (core) province
  • Monarch Le Directoire is active

Will happen within 50 days of December 27, 1797
Checked again every 50 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after February 23, 1798)

Description

Corsica had always been a strongly catholic province and was among the french regions which had counted the most refractory priests. The revolt that started in December 1797 in the North-East of the island became known as La Croceta (A Crucetta in Corsican) because of the small white cross that the first insurgents would sew upon their hats was mostly a religious revolt after years of administrative persecution against the Catholic church. The rebels were mostly peasants which explains that, when the foremost leaders were either killed or captured, the revolt would die down as quickly as it had started, in spite or because of the violent repression.

Actions

A. Darn!

  • Corsica revolts
  • Corsica revolts
  • -1000 population in Corsica

Back to top

170124. The military expedition in Egypt

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Country has at least 20 non-colonial provinces
  • Monarch Le Directoire is active
  • Egypt exists
  • Own Provence

Will happen within 10 days of January 1, 1798
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 1, 1799)

Description

In 1798, General Bonaparte proposed an expedition to seize Egypt, then a province of the Ottoman Empire, as a good way to protect French trade interests and undermine Britain's access to India. Although troubled by the scope and cost of the enterprise, the Directory readily agreed to the plan, also because it meant keeping the popular general far from Paris, where the rumours of his victories in the Italian military campaign made him famous and politically dangerous. So a large number of troops commanded by General Bonaparte set sail from Toulon via Malta, which was invaded for its essential strategic position in the Mediterranean sea routes, towards Alexandria where the French troops eventually disembarked together with a large group of scientists.

Actions

A. Let's oppose the British Empire

  • -50 relations with England
  • -200 relations with Order of St. John
  • -200 relations with Ottoman Empire
  • -200 relations with Egypt
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Egypt for 60 months
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Ottoman Empire for 60 months
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Order of St. John for 36 months
  • -150
  • +8000 infantry in Provence
  • Gain 10 warships in Provence

B. It's only a waste of money

  • +5 relations with England
  • +5 relations with Ottoman Empire
  • Event 170125 - At the Pyramids for France will never fire
  • Event 24057 - The Knights Leave Malta for Order of St. John will never fire
  • Event 363000 - Napolйon in Egypt for Egypt will never fire

170378. Lieven Bauwens

France — Not random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Burgundy exists

Will happen within 360 days of January 1, 1798
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1800)

Description

As the heir to the family leather business, Lieven Bauwens was interested in the process of the enterprise. He drew attention to the mule jenny, the secret of the British dominance in the cotton industry. Bauwens became involved in industrial espionage, smuggling the device out of Britain in pieces, putting himself on death row. When the industrialist took the last parts of the machine on board, the police hunted Bauwens to Hamburg. In the port, the British let him go in exchange for a ransom. Upon returning home, Bauwens put the mule jenny back together, and broke the British monopoly of the cotton industry.

Actions

A. Not all secrets are as reliable

  • Infrastructure tech investment: +50
  • -10 relations with England
  • Manufactory in a random province in (unknown geography type) is destroyed
  • Gain Goods Manufactory in Flandre

Back to top

3148. The 18 Brumaire

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Monarch Le Directoire is active

Will happen on November 9, 1799

Description

In November of 1799, Napolйon took part in the coup d'Etat of 18 and 19 Brumaire (9 and 10 November). Two members of the Directory (Sieyиs and Ducos) needing a popular general to neutralize the army and inspire the people, decided to use Napolйon. Violence broke out during the council session, which was quelled by Napolйon's soldiers (some of the council fled through the windows). The remaining council members approved a provisional executive government of three consuls. Napolйon was able to in effect seize power by having himself proclaimed First Consul. His position and a new constitution were shortly confirmed by popular vote, and the coming years he was able to unify the nation and reform the finances and all levels of government.

Actions

A. We need Brilliant Leadership!

  • Clear flag "[Napolйon_rank1]"
  • Set flag [Napolйon_rank0] for events
  • Centralization +2
  • Aristocracy +1
  • Innovativeness -1
  • Quality +3
  • Land tech investment: +2000
  • +50 artillery in the capital province
  • -150 relations with England
  • -150 relations with Austria
  • -150 relations with Spain
  • -150 relations with Prussia
  • -150 relations with Russia
  • -150 relations with Sweden
  • Stability +6
  • Event 21019 - The Rise of Napolйon for England is triggered immediately
  • Event 12124 - General Bonaparte First Consul for France is triggered immediately

B. We don't want a new Caesar!

  • Monarch Le Consulat becomes active
  • Set flag [Napolйon_rank1] for events
  • Centralization +1
  • +100 relations with England
  • +100 relations with Austria
  • +100 relations with Spain
  • +100 relations with Prussia
  • +100 relations with Russia
  • +100 relations with Sweden
  • +6 diplomats
  • +300
  • Stability +3

170106. The Helvetic Republic

France — Not random

Conditions

  • At least one of the following must occur:

    • Monarch Napolйon Bonaparte is active
    • Monarch Napolйon Ier is active

    • Switzerland is a vassal of France
    • All of the following must occur:
      • The following must not occur:
        • Switzerland exists
      • At least one of the following must occur:
        • Own Parma
        • Own Kermandec Islands

Will happen within 10 days of December 3, 1799
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

Following its mission to 'liberate' all the European populations from the grasp of the Ancien Rйgime, the French post-revolutionary governments abolished the Confederation and established the Helvetic Republic, with a single constitution, giving little consideration for the history and traditions of the Swiss country. Internal disorder would arise and steadily worsen. The pro-French puppet state would be unable to cope with the new 'innovative' situation. Anarchy prevailed then for years until the Restoration of Vienna re-established the Confederate government and confirm Switzerland perpetual neutrality.

170302. The Concordat with the Roman Catholic Church

France — Not random

Conditions

  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Monarch Napolйon Bonaparte is active
    • Monarch Napolйon Ier is active
  • Event 170300 - Boerenkrijg for France has already occurred

Will happen within 720 days of January 2, 1800
Checked again every 720 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1805)

Description

The Civil Constitution of the Clergy had reduced the number of bishoprics in France from 136 to 83, confiscated church property and turned priests into civil servants of the state. It had also alienated moderate reformers such as the Girondins who saw Catholicism as part of France. The resulting UltraMontaine movement that looked 'over the mountains' to Rome for salvation caused a split that the Jacobins had been able to exploit and that continued to cause problems in French society. Napolйon was determined to unify the country again and on 26 Messidor, IX (July 16, 1802) Pope Pius VII and First Consul Bonaparte reestablished the Catholic Church in France.

Actions

A. Reconcile with the Pope

  • Stability +2
  • +200 relations with Papal States
  • Global revolt risk -1 for 12 months
  • Revolt risk value in Flandre -3
  • Revolt risk value in Brabant -3
  • Revolt risk value in Hainaut -2
  • Revolt risk value in Letzebuerg -2
  • Revolt risk value in Artois -1
  • Revolt risk value in Cambrai -1
  • +1 base tax value in Flandre
  • +1 base tax value in Brabant

B. The Church should stay under control of the state

  • Stability -1
  • -25 relations with Papal States

Back to top

The Civil Constitution of the Clergy had reduced the number of bishoprics in France from 136 to 83, confiscated church property and turned priests into civil servants of the state. It had also alienated moderate reformers such as the Girondins who saw Catholicism as part of France. The resulting UltraMontaine movement that looked 'over the mountains' to Rome for salvation caused a split that the Jacobins had been able to exploit and that continued to cause problems in French society. Napolйon was determined to unify the country again and on 26 Messidor, IX (July 16, 1802) Pope Pius VII and First Consul Bonaparte reestablished the Catholic Church in France.

12135. Code Napolйon

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Country is not at war
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Monarch Napolйon Bonaparte is active
    • Monarch Napolйon Ier is active

Will happen within 360 days of January 2, 1800
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1811)

Description

Napolйon's most famous domestic accomplishment, and perhaps his greatest legacy, was his legal work. France's laws were comprised of regional codes, courts, case law - almost 15,000 (often contradictory) decrees in all. Napolйon oversaw the revision of the code, providing critical unity of law, respecting the needs of the middle class, even introducing significant property and family rights for women.

Actions

A. Excellent!

  • Stability +2
  • Serfdom -1

12132. Civil Reform

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Country is not at war
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Monarch Napolйon Bonaparte is active
    • Monarch Napolйon Ier is active

Will happen within 360 days of January 2, 1800
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1811)

Description

A brief interlude of peace allowed Napolйon to divert his energies to civil reform. He intended to make Paris 'not only the lovliest city that is, but the lovliest that could ever be.' Plans for canals, resovoirs, and bridges were laid, giving Paris her modern water supply. Streets were renumbered, the quays of the Seine reorganized. The Quay d'Orsay, Bourse, the Halle des Vins (a wine trade center), the Louvre (Musйe Napolйon), Arc du Carrousel, Vendфme Column, Arc de Triomphe, numerous parks, and the restoration of churches were planned, started, or even completed during Napolйon's reign. Additionally, a new corp of engineers, the Ponts et Chaussйes, was created to improve roads and bridges throughout France.

Actions

A. Reform

  • Infrastructure tech investment: +800
  • Trade tech investment: +250
  • -100

B. Let it Be

  • Infrastructure tech investment: -200
  • +200

Back to top

12134. Lycees

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Country is not at war
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Monarch Napolйon Bonaparte is active
    • Monarch Napolйon Ier is active

Will happen within 360 days of January 2, 1800
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1811)

Description

Education had previously been conducted largely by village priests and religious orders such as the Jesuits. The Revolution introduced secular education in 1795, and Napolйon later introduced the Lycees, or state secondary schools, which provided a steady flow of military and administrative personnel to the military and government. For example, the Ecole Polytechnique founded by the Convention was transformed into a military college for gunners and engineers.

Actions

A. Establish the Schools

  • Innovativeness +3
  • Quality +1
  • Land tech investment: +500
  • -100

B. Save Our Money

  • Innovativeness -1
  • Quality -1

Back to top

170035. The second treaty of San Ildefonso

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Monarch Napolйon Bonaparte is active
  • Spain exists
  • Portugal exists
  • England exists

Will happen on October 2, 1800

Description

After the first treaty of San Ildefonso, Spain became a reliable ally for France in her wars with England, however Spain suffered the worse part. Her navy was seriously damaged, and her vital commerce with her American colonies was interrupted, strangling her economy, and she was finally forced to sue for peace. This situation left Napolйon's navy in a complete inferiority in the peninsula, as the British navy could use the ports in Portugal, her traditional ally. Napolйon needed Spanish collaboration to win the war at sea, however Spain, now at peace with England wanted to remain neutral. To Napolйon, Spanish collaboration was vital, not only to prevent shipping to England from Spanish ports, but also to enforce the blockade in Portugal. Spanish prime minister, Manuel Godoy, was given no choice, either with France or against France, and he vowed to Napolйon demands.

Actions

A. Impose the treaty on Spain

  • +50 relations with Spain
  • -25 relations with England
  • -25 relations with Portugal
  • Event 285063 - The second treaty of San Ildefonso for Spain is triggered immediately

B. Let Spain remain neutral

  • -25 relations with Spain

Back to top

170125. At the Pyramids

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 170124 - The military expedition in Egypt for France has already occurred
  • Event 3148 - The 18 Brumaire for France has already occurred
  • England and France are at war
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Own Urdun
    • Own Suriye
    • Own Beyrut
    • Event 363000 - Napolйon in Egypt for Egypt has already occurred
    • Egypt is a vassal of France

Will happen within 10 days of January 1, 1801
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)
unless prevented by
Action B of 170124 - The military expedition in Egypt for France

Description

In their marching to Cairo the French troops had to fight against the Mamluks which were easily tamed in the socalled 'battle of the Pyramids' but a terrible defeat at the bay of Abu Qir by means of the British Navy skillfully commanded by Admiral Nelson cut the French supply lines. Bonaparte continued his military campaign by attacking the Turks in Syria but both desease and short supplies which weakened his soldiers and the bad news coming from France forced him to leave Egypt abandoning there his troops. Successfully dodging the British fleet constantly patrolling the Mediterranean in search of French presence, he managed to make return to France where the coup d'йtat of the 18 Brumaire would then have occurred. Letting alone and without command and precise orders, the French troops found themselves at the mercy of the British troops better fitted and supplied. Even if they managed to win some battles they eventually surrendered to the British, however they were taken home by means of the British navy itself.The Napolйon's expedition in Egypt, even if a complete failure under the military aspect, was a huge worldwide success under the cultural historical aspect: with the French occupation the egyptology, the study of ancient Egypt, was born!

Actions

A. Let's retreat from Egypt

  • Grant independence to Egypt
  • Cede Urdun to Egypt
  • Cede Suriye to Egypt
  • Cede Beyrut to Egypt
  • +350
  • Infrastructure tech investment: +600
  • Event 363000 - Napolйon in Egypt for Egypt will never fire
  • Event 363001 - French troops abandon Egypt for Egypt is triggered immediately

B. Let's withstand the Turks

  • -50 relations with Ottoman Empire
  • Lose 5000 troops in Urdun
  • Lose 5000 troops in Suriye
  • Lose 5000 troops in Beyrut
  • Urdun revolts
  • Urdun revolts
  • Suriye revolts
  • Suriye revolts
  • Beyrut revolts
  • Beyrut revolts
  • Event 363000 - Napolйon in Egypt for Egypt will never fire

12125. The Napoleonic Wars

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Country has at least 20 non-colonial provinces
  • Monarch Napolйon Bonaparte is active

Will happen within 20 days of May 2, 1803
Checked again every 20 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1804)

Description

Napolйon introduced wide ranging reforms into the territories that he captured from his opponents. He abolished most of the hereditary privileges of the nobility and clergy, reformed land ownership to allow the peasantry real control of their lives, and codified laws so that all citizens would be treated equally under a single set of rationalized laws. He eliminated preferment based on birth from all appointments, by the state or otherwise. These reforms challenged and threated every ancien regime state of Europe, and these states reacted forcefully to contain French ideals.

Actions

A. Let's 'liberate' the European populations

  • Monarch's diplomatic skill +2 for 60 months
  • Monarch's military skill +2 for 60 months
  • Monarch's administrative skill -2 for 60 months
  • -100 relations with England
  • -100 relations with Prussia
  • -100 relations with Austria
  • -100 relations with Spain
  • -100 relations with Russia
  • -100 relations with Germany
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against England for 192 months
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Prussia for 192 months
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Austria for 192 months
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Spain for 192 months
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Russia for 192 months
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Savoy for 192 months
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Naples for 192 months
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Portugal for 192 months
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Germany for 192 months
  • Event 12126 - The Napoleonic Wars for Prussia is triggered immediately
  • Event 12127 - The Napoleonic Wars for Austria is triggered immediately
  • Event 12128 - The Napoleonic Wars for Spain is triggered immediately
  • Event 12129 - The Napoleonic Wars for Russia is triggered immediately
  • Event 21128 - The Napoleonic Wars for England is triggered immediately
  • Event 275015 - The Napoleonic Wars for Savoy is triggered immediately
  • Event 239014 - The Napoleonic Wars for Naples is triggered immediately
  • Event 260016 - The Napoleonic Wars for Portugal is triggered immediately
  • Event 366112 - The Napoleonic Wars for Germany is triggered immediately

B. Let's turn to domestic policies instead

  • +50 relations with England
  • +50 relations with Austria
  • +50 relations with Spain
  • +50 relations with Russia
  • +50 relations with Savoy
  • +50 relations with Papal States
  • +50 relations with Naples
  • +50 relations with Portugal
  • +50 relations with Germany
  • Monarch's diplomatic skill -2 for 60 months
  • Monarch's military skill -2 for 60 months
  • Monarch's administrative skill +2 for 60 months
  • -5 victory points
  • Event 3149 - The Empire of France for France will never fire

170140. Jean-Baptiste Say

France — Not random

Conditions

  • The following must not occur:
    • Mercantilism is at 6 or higher

Will happen within 50 days of July 2, 1803
Checked again every 50 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

Jean-Baptiste Say was inspired to write his Treatise on Political Economy when, working at a life insurance office, he read a copy of Adam Smith's Wealth of Nations. His Treatise, often described as a popularization of Smith's ideas, departed from the typical economics methodology of his day. This departure was based on Say's conviction that the study of economics should start not with abstract mathematical and statistical analyses but with the real experience of the human person. Such a humanistic stress resulted in Say's emphasis on the role of the entrepreneur in an economy. In fact, this emphasis was Say's primary contribution to the field of economics. While popular abroad, Say's Treatise brought put him into conflict with Napolйon, who was furious at Say's refusal to tone down his criticism of France's disastrous fiscal policies. This run in with the French dictator soon forced Say to put his theory into practice. He was removed from the French government, and his book was suppressed. Undaunted, Say used the latest English technology to establish a cotton spinning plant, which became quite profitable for the ten years he owned it. Meanwhile, Say and his Treatise came to the attention of Thomas Jefferson and James Madison. Madison thought it the best book ever written about economics. Jefferson courted Say to be a professor of political economy at the new University of Virginia. It was not until 1814, with Napolйon exiled, that Say's Treatise came back into print in France. Say himself was finally appointed to a professorship in economics, first at the Athйnйe, then at the Conservatoire des Arts et Metiers, and finally at the College de France, where he occupied France's first chair in political economy.

Actions

A. A great economist!

  • Mercantilism -1
  • -3% inflation
  • Trade tech investment: +500

Back to top

3149. The Empire of France

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Monarch Napolйon Bonaparte is active
  • Event 12125 - The Napoleonic Wars for France has already occurred

Will happen within 190 days of May 19, 1804
Checked again every 190 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 3, 1804)
unless prevented by
Action B of 12125 - The Napoleonic Wars for France

Description

After the defeat of Austria and Prussia Napolйon had a free hand to reorganize Europe and numerous relatives to install on the thrones of his satellite Kingdoms. The result was known as the Grand Empire. In a glamorous crowning Napolйon picked his crown from the hands of the Pope and put it on his own head. Then he started to readdress Europe. Having annexed Tuscany, Piedmont, Genoa, and the Rhineland directly into France, Napolйon placed the Kingdom of Holland (which until 1806 was the Batavian Commonwealth) under his brother Louis, the Kingdom of Westphalia under his brother Jйrфme, the Kingdom of Italy under his stepson Eugиne as his viceroy, the Kingdom of Spain under his brother Joseph, and the Grand Duchy of Warsaw (carved out of Prussian Poland) under the nominal sovereignty of his ally the King of Saxony. To link his allied states in northern and southern Germany, Napolйon created the Confederation of the Rhine. Even Austria seemed to fall into Napolйon's sphere of influence with his marriage to Archduchess Maria Louise in 1810

Actions

A. Vive l'Empereur !

  • Flag graphics extension set to "Empire"
  • Monarch Napolйon Ier becomes active
  • Centralization +3
  • Aristocracy +2
  • Serfdom +3
  • Innovativeness -2
  • Offensive Doctrine +1
  • Quality +1
  • Mercantilism +3
  • -100 relations with England
  • -100 relations with Austria
  • -100 relations with Spain
  • -100 relations with Prussia
  • -100 relations with Russia
  • -100 relations with Sweden
  • Stability +3
  • Event 170126 - Napolйon's ambitions for France is triggered immediately

B. Deepen the value of the Republic

  • Centralization +1
  • Aristocracy -3
  • Innovativeness +2
  • Offensive Doctrine -2
  • Quality -1
  • Mercantilism -3
  • +6 merchants
  • Trade tech investment: +1000
  • Stability +3
  • Monarch's diplomatic skill -3 for 192 months
  • Monarch's military skill -3 for 192 months
  • -10 victory points
  • Event 3790 - The French Gamble for Supremacy for France will never fire

170029. The Crown of Italy

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Istria
  • Own Ferrara
  • Monarch Napolйon Ier is active
  • The following must not occur:
    • Event 170030 - The Restoration of the Italian Monarchies for France has already occurred
  • Event 170127 - The military expedition in Italy for France has already occurred
  • Event 193802 - The Kingdom of Italy for Italy has already occurred
  • Italy is a vassal of France

Will happen within 20 days of May 2, 1805
Checked again every 20 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)
unless prevented by
Action B of 170127 - The military expedition in Italy for France

Description

In 1805, following Bonaparte's assumption of the title of Emperor of the French, the Italian Republic was transformed into the Kingdom of Italy (Regno d'Italia), with Napolйon as King and his stepson Eugиne de Beauharnais as Viceroy. The 'Corona Ferrea' or the 'Iron Crown of the Lombards' (still nowadays kept in Monza's Dome, a city near Milan) so called from a narrow band of iron within it, said to be beaten out of one of the nails used at the Crucifixion, was worn for the last time in history by Charles V of Habsburg when he was crowned Holy Roman Emperor and King of Italy by the Pope Clemens VII at Bologna in 1530. On 26 May 1805 in a ceremony arranged in Milan's Dome Napolйon crowned himself King of Italy and said the ritual words: 'God gave it to me, woe to him who touches it'. These were the words spoken for the first time by Charlemagne when he received the crown as King of the Lombards in 774.

Actions

A. We are King of Italy

  • Cede Istria to Italy
  • Cede Ferrara to Italy

Back to top

12136. Napolйon's Marshals

Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after May 21, 1806)

Description

The Ecole Spйciale Militaire founded in 1802 meant that the French officer corps was fast becoming an imposingly elite group. In 1804, Napolйon re-instituted the title of Marshal, abolished by the revolution. It has been said that every French soldier carried a Marshal's baton in his knapsack - in 1805 only 2 of 26 Marshals had noble antecedents, while half the officer corps had risen from the ranks...

That's why he decided to assign the Kingdom of Naples to his brother Giuseppe after the Bourbon Kings hastily escaped to Sicily once the French troops descended Italy.

Checked again every 50 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1810)
unless prevented by
Action B of 170222 - The creation of the Grand Duchy of Berg and Cleves for France

Description

Although Napolйon had originally claimed only the left bank of the Rhine for France, which he had achieved by the peace of Campoformio in 1797, he forced Bavaria to cede Berg and Jьlich in 1806 and took Kleve from Prussia in 1805. To maintain at least the impression of legitimacy he did not directly annex these territories to France but chose to bestow them upon his loyal general Joachim Murat instead as the independent 'Grand Duchy of Berg'. This new country had only a short existence, and after the congress of Vienna it became part of Prussia.

Actions

A. Give Kleve, Jьlich and Berg to Joachim Murat

Will happen within 30 days of July 7, 1807
Checked again every 30 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

The Duchy of Warsaw was a Polish state established by Napolйon in 1807 from the Polish lands ceded by the Kingdom of Prussia under the terms of the Treaties of Tilsit. The duchy was held in personal union by one of Napolйon's allies, King Friedrich August III of Saxony.
Following Napolйon's failed invasion of Russia, the duchy was occupied by Prussian and Russian troops until 1815, when it was formally partitioned between the two countries at the Congress of Vienna.

3790. The French Gamble for Supremacy

France — Not random

Conditions

  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Monarch Napolйon Bonaparte is active
    • Monarch Napolйon Ier is active
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Spain is a vassal of France
    • The following must not occur:
      • Spain exists
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Austria is a vassal of France
    • The following must not occur:
      • Austria exists
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • All of the following must occur:
      • Event 263014 - The Kingdom of Prussia for Prussia has already occurred
      • Prussia is a vassal of France
    • All of the following must occur:
      • The following must not occur:
        • Prussia exists
      • Event 263014 - The Kingdom of Prussia for Prussia has already occurred
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Russia is a vassal of France
    • The following must not occur:
      • Russia exists

Will happen within 10 days of January 2, 1809
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)
unless prevented by
Action B of 3149 - The Empire of France for France

Description

In 1809 Austria had been crushed and also Prussia was occupied. France was at war with England, but had managed to vassalize Spain. Russia was her ally and everything looked perfect until in 1812… The Russians did not fulfill there obligations when come to the Continental Blockade and they had become vary with French power. In June France invaded Russia with more than a half million men. The Russians made a slow retreat even the odds as the French army shrink from attrition. The Battle of Borodino (September 5-7) started as a bloody struggle, but thanks to luck and a diversion attack by Marshal Ney the Russian Army was annihilated. Napolйon though decided a halt on his Grand Armйe spreading it out for winter. Supply lines where secured and a lesser task force called L'Armйe Baltique moved up occupying the Baltic coast up to St:Petersburg which it took by assault. When late spring came Napolйon again had more than half a million men in Russia and advancing. During the winter Napolйon had restructured Poland under Poniatowski and recreated the Kingdom of Ukraine under Chielmkowskij easing the supply effort. On 30 June 1813 Russia surrendered, unwilling to let Moscow perish in flames. France was the master of Europe...

Actions

A. We are the Masters of Europe!

  • +1000 victory points
  • +1000
  • +300 relations with Spain
  • +300 relations with Austria
  • +300 relations with Prussia
  • +300 relations with Russia
  • Stability +3

Back to top

3785. The Restoration of the French Monarchy

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Monarch Napolйon Ier is active
  • England controls Ile de France

Will happen within 10 days of January 2, 1809
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)
unless prevented by
Action A of 3786 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France
Action A of 3787 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France
Action A of 3788 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France
Action A of 3789 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France

Description

Many countries had viewed the French revolution with neutral mistrust or eager interest, but with the Reign of Terror and the Execution of King Louis most countries became abhorred. The New Republic and its ideas undermined the 'Old Order' that existed in most European countries. Those several alliances were set up to restore the Bourbons to the French Throne, crush the revolution and get Europe back to normal again. This succeeded in 1814 and again in 1815 when foreign armies brought Louis XVIII on the throne. Louis XVIII was the brother of the Executed King Louis of France and in early life was known as the Comte de Provence. He remained in Paris after the outbreak of the French Revolution in 1789 but escaped to Belgium two years later. After King Louis' execution in 1793 he proclaimed himself regent, and after the death of his brother's heir in 1795, he took the title Louis XVIII. He lived as an exile in various European countries until he became King after Napolйon's first abdication in 1814. On Napolйon's return to power in 1815, however, Louis again fled to Belgium.

Actions

A. King Louis XVIII

  • Monarch Louis XVIII becomes active
  • Stability +1
  • Aristocracy +1
  • Serfdom +1
  • Innovativeness -1
  • Offensive Doctrine -2
  • Flag graphics extension set to "Bourbon"
  • Event 3086 - Restoration of the French Monarchy for England is triggered immediately
  • Event 3786 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France will never fire
  • Event 3787 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France will never fire
  • Event 3788 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France will never fire
  • Event 3789 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France will never fire

Back to top

    • Netherlands exists
    • Own Holland

Will happen within 1 days of January 2, 1809
Checked again every 1 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after January 2, 1820)

Description

After Coalition troops reinstated the French monarchy they decided to form a new country out of the northern and southern Netherlands, the United Kingdom of the Netherlands, as a buffer state against France with Stadtholder Willem V's son as King Willem I.

12137. Fresh Conscripts

France — Not random

Conditions

  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Monarch Napolйon Ier is active
    • Monarch Napolйon Ier is active
  • Country is at war

Will happen within 360 days of January 2, 1810
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

Prolonged war on multiple fronts was a drain on the manpower of France. Losses occured more due to the effects of disease and famine than battle. While fresh levies were readily drawn up, there was never time to drill and train them to the peak of efficiency attained by the Grande Armee of 1805.

Actions

A. C'est la Vie...

  • Quality -1
  • Offensive Doctrine -1

170030. The Restoration of the Italian Monarchies

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 170126 - Napolйon's ambitions for France has already occurred
  • Austria exists
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Event 3785 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3786 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3787 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3788 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3789 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred

Will happen within 10 days of January 2, 1810
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

In the Congress of Vienna, all the Italian monarchs chased away by the Napoleonic troops were restored in their Kingdoms: the Kingdom of Sardinia which obtained Genoa, the Grand-Duchy of Tuscany, the Duchy of Parma, the Duchy of Modena and Reggio, the Papal States, the Kingdom of Two Sicilies. Everything seemed to be made in order to create a balance of powers in Italy between those minor states under the Austrian rule. The Napoleonic design of a united Italy which was unsuccessfully pursued by Murat with his proclamation at Rimini, was still to be postponed...

  • Cede Shighnan to England
  • Cede Lombardia to Austria
  • Cede Bresia to Austria

  • Cede Marchfeld to Austria
  • Cede Steiermark to Austria
  • Cede Tirol to Austria
  • Istria will no longer be considered a national province

  • Bresia will no longer be considered a national province

3791. The Return of Napolйon

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Monarch Louis XVIII is active
  • Country is at war
  • The following must not occur:
    • Stability is at 2 or higher

Will happen within 10 days of January 2, 1810
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

In November 1813 the allies offered Napolйon peace if France would return to her natural boundaries, the Rhine and the Alps. Napolйon rejected the offer, and the allies continued their advance. They closed in on Paris, which fell to them on Mar. 31, 1814. Napolйon abdicated, first in favor of his son and then unconditionally (Apr. 11). He was exiled to Elba, which the allies gave him as a sovereign principality. His victors were still deliberating at the Congress of Vienna when Napolйon, with a handful of followers, landed near Cannes (Mar. 1, 1815). King Louis XVIII reacted and sent Marshal Ney with a considerable force to capture Napolйon and bring him to Paris in an Iron Cage. But Ney did not follow the orders of his new master, but returned to the side of his old. In the course of a triumphant march northward Napolйon once more rallied France behind him. King Louis XVIII fled, and Napolйon entered Paris (Mar. 20), beginning his ephemeral rule of the Hundred Days. Will it be any longer?

Actions

A. Our Emperor is back!

  • Monarch Napolйon Ier becomes active
  • -150 relations with England
  • -150 relations with Austria
  • -150 relations with Spain
  • -150 relations with Prussia
  • -150 relations with Russia
  • -150 relations with Sweden
  • +20 national manpower
  • Stability +1
  • Flag graphics extension set to "Empire"

Back to top

170128. The restoration of the European monarchies

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 170126 - Napolйon's ambitions for France has already occurred
  • Austria exists
  • England exists
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Event 3785 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3786 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3787 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3788 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3789 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred

Will happen within 10 days of January 2, 1810
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

The Congress of Vienna brought Europe back to its boundaries before the French Revolution. Only the former Republics of Genoa and Venice weren't granted the restoration of their pre-revolutionary governments. Since any sort of socalled Republic was now the most hated by all the monarchies of the restoration, they were respectively given to Savoy as to form a medium buffer state against France and to Austria as to strengthen her position in Southern Europe.

Actions

A. Back to our pre-revolutionary borders

  • Grant independence to Berg
  • Event 235011 - The restoration of the Duchy of Berg for Berg is triggered immediately
  • Event 170258 - The restoration of the Duchy of Berg for France is triggered immediately
  • Event 200027 - The restoration of the Duchy of Cleves for Berg is triggered immediately

  • Cede Meissen to Prussia
  • Cede Brabant to Prussia
  • Cede Sachsen to Austria
  • Cede Cottbus to Austria
  • Cede Glogau to Austria
  • Cede Tabor to Austria
  • Cede Sumava to Austria
  • Cede Straubing to Austria
  • Cede Landshut to Austria
  • Cede Mьnchen to Austria
  • Cede Parma to Austria
  • Cede Kermandec Islands to Austria
  • Cede Friuli to Austria
  • Cede Verona to Austria
  • Cede Trentin to Austria
  • Cede Utrecht to Austria
  • Cede Meissen to Austria
  • Cede Breda to England
  • Cede Liegnitz to England
  • Cede Banat to Spain
  • Cede Navarra to Spain
  • Cede Szekelyfold to Spain
  • Cede Bucovina to Spain
  • Breda will no longer be considered a national province
  • Lausitz will no longer be considered a national province
  • Glogau will no longer be considered a national province
  • Liegnitz will no longer be considered a national province
  • Breslau will no longer be considered a national province
  • Oels will no longer be considered a national province
  • Holland will no longer be considered a national province
  • Cechy will no longer be considered a national province
  • Sudety will no longer be considered a national province
  • Sumava will no longer be considered a national province
  • Parma will no longer be considered a national province
  • Banat will no longer be considered a national province
  • Szekelyfold will no longer be considered a national province

170284. The restoration of the Kingdom of Poland

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Event 170126 - Napolйon's ambitions for France has already occurred
  • Russia exists
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Poland exists
    • All of the following must occur:
      • At least one of the following must occur:
        • Own Hannover
        • Own Hoya
        • Own Nassau
      • The following must not occur:
        • Russia owns Hannover
      • The following must not occur:
        • Poland exists
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Event 3785 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3786 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3787 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3788 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3789 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred

Will happen within 10 days of January 2, 1810
Checked again every 10 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

In the Congress of Vienna, Poland again was the victim of the victorious powers appetite. As most Poles had been staunch supporters of the French to the very end - only a group of Polish nobles around Prince Adam Czartoryski had accepted the Czar as Poland's lord - they were not represented on the Congress. Russian Czar Alexander planned the reestablihment of a Polish Kingdom in dynastic union with Russia. This kingdom would comprise of the Duchy of Warsaw an possibly include territories further east, acquired by Russia in the Polish Partitions 1772-1795.
However, the British side had objections, and a compromise was found according to which the province of Posen became Prussian, and the rest of the Duchy of Poland (Congress Poland) was reestablished as a Kingdom, in dynastic union with Russia. Cracow was declared a free city under the joint protection of its three neighbours, Austria, Prussia and Russia.

Actions

A. Back to our pre-revolutionary borders

  • Grant independence to Poland
  • Cede Hannover to Poland
  • Cede Hoya to Poland
  • Cede Lippe to Poland
  • Cede Westfalen to Poland
  • Cede Kleef to Poland
  • Cede Nassau to Poland
  • Cede Jьlich to Poland
  • Event 258091 - The restoration of the Kingdom of Poland for Poland is triggered immediately
  • Cede Westfalen to Austria
  • Cede Kleef to Austria
  • Cede Jьlich to Prussia
  • Cede Lippe to Russia
  • Cede Mekelnborg to Russia
  • Cede Wolgast to Russia
  • Cede Neumark to Russia
  • Cede Lebus to Russia
  • Cede Berlin to Russia
  • Cede Brandenburg to Russia
  • Cede Magdeburg to Russia
  • Cede Bremen to Russia
  • Cede Ollnborg to Russia
  • Cede Ostfriesen to Russia
  • Cede Yedisan to Russia
  • Cede Moria to Russia
  • Cede Belgorod to Russia
  • Cede Donetsk to Russia
  • Cede Zaporozhe to Russia

Back to top

170274. Waterloo

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Monarch Napolйon Ier is active
  • Country is at war

Will happen within 100 days of January 2, 1810
Checked again every 100 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 31, 1819)

Description

The second period of Napoleonic rule, now known as the Hundred Days (les Cent Jours), ended quickly with his defeat at Waterloo on 18 June 1815. Napolйon spent the remaining six years of his life under British supervision on the island of St. Helena in the Atlantic Ocean.

Actions

A. Vive Louis XVIII !

  • Monarch Louis XVIII becomes active
  • Flag graphics extension set to "Bourbon"

B. Let's fight to the bitter end...

  • Stability -6

170280. Annexation of the Kingdom of Holland

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Monarch Napolйon Ier is active
  • Event 170026 - The Kingdom of Holland for France has already occurred
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • All of the following must occur:
      • Netherlands exists
      • The following must not occur:
        • Brabant is a national (core) province of Netherlands
    • All of the following must occur:
      • The following must not occur:
        • Netherlands exists
      • Own Holland

Will happen within 13 days of July 1, 1810
Checked again every 13 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1810)
unless prevented by
Action B of 170026 - The Kingdom of Holland for France
Action A of 170027 - Restoration of the Orange dynasty in the Netherlands for France

Description

Much to the surprise of Napolйon, Louis took his royal responsibilities seriously and attempted to rule in the interests of the Dutch. In particular he enraged his elder brother by not taking sufficiently strenuous measures to prevent trade between the Dutch ports and Britain, thus leaving a loophole in the Continental System.
Louis had to abdicate on July 1, 1810. He was succeeded by his five year old son Napolйon Louis Bonaparte. Napolйon Louis reigned as Louis II for just ten days. Napolйon ignored his young nephew's accession to the throne, abolished the Kingdom of Holland and incorporated the region under direct rule within the French Empire.

Actions

A. OK

  • Annex Netherlands
  • Breslau will be considered a claim province
  • Oels will be considered a claim province
  • Holland will be considered a claim province
  • Zeeland will be considered a claim province

Back to top

170266. War of the Fium'orbu

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Own Corsica
  • Corsica is a national (core) province
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Event 3785 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3786 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3787 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3788 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred
    • Event 3789 - The Restoration of the French Monarchy for France has already occurred

Will happen within 100 days of February 15, 1816
Checked again every 100 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after June 26, 1816)

Description

Bernardinu Poli was a much trusted and faithful Bonapartist Corsican officer. When it became known that he was still in possession of the diamonds left to him by Joachim Murat before his departure for Naples, and that he was 'keeping himself', according to the Corsican saying, in his small village at Sari di Porti Vechju, the Marquis de Riviиre, Extraordinary Commissar of Louis XVIII in Corsica, attempted to capture him. First by treason, which failed, then by force which failed too faced with the arising of the whole region known as the Fium'orbu. On 18 April 1816, a 8000 strong French army was defeated and Riviиre was nearly captured. Shortly after this humiliating defeat, Riviиre was removed from office and his successor negotiated Poli's exile for Austria, with the diamonds.

Actions

A. Darn!

  • Ile de France revolts
  • Ile de France revolts
  • Ile de France revolts
  • Ile de France revolts

Back to top

170023. A Sister-Republic in Italy

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 170127 - The military expedition in Italy for France

Description

After the first successful Italian campaign with the battle of Lodi in 1796, General Napolйon Bonaparte proceeded to organize two states in Northern Italy: one on the south of the Po River, the Cispadane Republic, and one on the north, the Transpadane Republic. These two were successively merged into the Cisalpine Republic on 29 June 1797 with the capital in Milan. The Cisalpine Republic consisted of roughly the former Duchy of Milan, those portions of the Republic of Venice west of the Adige River, the Duchy of Modena, the Papal Legations, the Piedmontese province of Novara, west of Ticino River and the Valtellina. But The Republic would have dissolved after the defeats of France against the Second Coalition in 1799 occupied by Austro-Russian forces. Only in 1800 in the second Italian campaign after the Battle of Marengo First Consul Napolйon Bonaparte retook the territories which this time were extended to the former Austrian lands of the Veneto and the Papal Legations. In January 1802, the Cisalpine Republic changed its name to Italian Republic with Napolйon Bonaparte as its president.

Actions

A. Merge the two Republics!

  • Lombardia will no longer be considered a national province
  • Bresia will no longer be considered a national province
  • Mantova will no longer be considered a national province
  • Gain an alliance with Italy
  • Cede Bresia to Italy
  • Cede Mantova to Italy

Back to top

170143. A great victory

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 164039 - Charles le moyne d'Iberville for England

Description

The son of an innkeeper, Charles Le Moyne (1661-1706) was one of New France's greatest commanders, fighting by land and sea in the Hudson Bay, Acadia and Louisiana for France but his greatest military campaign was in Newfoundland. Beginning in 1696 with 1000 marines d'Iberville began a campaign against the scattered English settlements on the Avalon Peninsula where he destroyed 33 out of 35 English settlements and captured 14 million kilograms of cod. D'Iberville's expedition brought riches to France and devasted the English presence on Newfoundland.

Actions

A. Hurray!

  • Culture in Beothuk changes to french
  • Culture in Taqamkuk changes to french
  • Culture in Wabana changes to french

Back to top

170164. A new military expedition to Naples

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 111016 - The Treaty of Granada for Aragon
Action A of 285103 - The Treaty of Granada for Spain

Description

On 11 November 1500, in Granada, Louis XII of France and Ferdinand II of Aragon stipulated a treaty by which they agreed on an equal partition of the Neapolitan territories: the northern part of the Kingdom including Terra del Lavoro and Abruzzi was to be given to France whilst the southern part of the Kingdom including Calabria and Apulia was to be given to Aragon/Spain.

Actions

A. Naples belongs to the crown of France

  • -50
  • Start a war with Naples

B. Don't intervene in Naples immediately

  • -25 relations with Spain
  • -25 relations with Aragon
  • -50 relations with Naples

12064. Bassompierre

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 12063 - Siege of La Rochelle for France

Description

Baron de Bassompierre has distinguished himself both in the army and at the court of Henry IV. After the death of Henry he remained loyal to the Queen, Marie de Medici, during her regency. Later, he served as an ambassador to Spain and England, and also fought against the Huguenots in 1621-22 and again in 1627-28. Due to his opposition to Cardinal Richelieu and his alleged part in the intrigue, he was imprisoned in 1631 in the Bastille until after the cardinal's death in 1643.

170054. Charles VI elected Holy Roman Emperor

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 179082 - Charles VI elected Holy Roman Emperor for Austria

Description

The war of Spanish succession seemed about to be won by the Grand Alliance in 1709, with France completely defeated in all fronts. Only the war in Spain seemed favorable to the Bourbons, but Louis XIV was ready to abandon his grandson in exchange for peace. But the allies were frustrated by their inability to impose the Archduke on the Spaniards, and surprised by their stern resistance, and went too far in their conditions demanding that Louis should remove his own grandson from the throne of Spain by force. This was a humiliation too big to endure, and Louis understood that he was negotiating from a position of weakness and decided to break the negotiations and renew the fight. Time would prove him right, as dissensions were already dividing the allies as the French threat receded. The Dutch and the Austrians were already at odds over the Spanish Netherlands, and the Austrians were seeing as not doing their part, occupied with the Hungarian revolt. The turning point was the unexpected death of Emperor Joseph I, at 33 years of age in April 1711. While Charles left Spain and went to Vienna to be elected emperor, the allies were not ready to reconstruct the empire of Charles V, and England immediately started peace negotiations with France without informing the Dutch or Austria.

Actions

A. Our chance for peace

  • Stability +1
  • Monarch's diplomatic skill +2 for 24 months

Back to top

3736. French Inheritance of Lothringen

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 3735 - French Inheritance of Lothringen for Lorraine

Description

On the death (1733) of Augustus II, Stanislaw returned to Poland from France and was again elected King. Under Russian pressure, a minority of the Polish diet chose instead Augustus III, precipitating the War of the Polish Succession. Stanislaw, besieged at Danzig, received only moral support from France, while his rival was backed by Holy Roman Emperor Charles VI and had full military aid from Russia. Stanislaw was obliged to flee from Danzig in 1734, and in 1735 he accepted the terms of the preliminary Treaty of Vienna. He kept the royal title but renounced his actual rights in favor of Augustus III. In exchange, he received Lorraine and Bar, with the provision that they were to pass directly to the French crown upon his death. The former duke of Lorraine (later Holy Roman Emperor Francis I) was compensated with the promise of Tuscany. Stanislaw' daughter, Maria Leszczynska, is married to Louis XV of France and upon her father's death Lorraine become part of France.

Actions

A. Stanislaw of Lorraine has died

  • Inherit the realms of Lorraine
  • Barrois will be considered a claim province
  • Lorraine will be considered a claim province
  • Barrois leaves the Holy Roman Empire
  • Lorraine leaves the Holy Roman Empire
  • Stability +1

Back to top

  • -25 relations with Switzerland

170022. French troops abandon Savoy

France — Not random

Conditions

  • Savoy exists
  • At least one of the following must occur:
    • Own Savoue
    • Own Piemont
    • Own Caux

Triggered by

Action A of 170021 - The Independence of Savoy for France
Action A of 285098 - The Independence of Savoy for Spain

Description

Emmanuel-Philibert of the House of Savoy, also known as Tкte de Fer, served in Charles's army during the war against Franзois Ier of France, distinguishing himself by capturing Hesdin in July 1553. A month later, he became duke of Savoy on the death of his father, but this was a nearly empty honor, as the vast majority of his hereditary lands had been occupied and administered by the French since 1536. Instead, he continued to serve the Habsburgs in hopes of recovering his lands, and served Philip II as lieutenant general in Flanders. In this capacity he personally led the Spanish invasion of northern France and won a brilliant victory at Saint-Quentin on 10 August 1557. With the Peace of Cateau-Cambrйsis between France and Spain, the duchy was restored to Emmanuel-Philibert, who then married Margaret of Valois, sister of Henry II of France.

Actions

A. Let's withdraw our troops

  • Cede Savoue to Savoy
  • Cede Piemont to Savoy
  • Cede Caux to Savoy

Back to top

12124. General Bonaparte First Consul

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 3148 - The 18 Brumaire for France

Description

Born in Corsica on 15th August 1768, Napolйon Bonaparte undertook military education at the royal military college of Brienne (graduated in 1785). A young artillery lieutenant when the French revolution erupted, he grabbed his first opportunity at the siege of Toulon in 1793 and then become the youngest general in the French revolutionary armies. A military genius, his victories in Italy in 1796 (and again 1800) and his campaign in Egypt 1798 would sharpen his thirst for power and he would become consul, then Emperor, marking the dawn of a new age.

Actions

A. Excellent!

  • Centralization +2
  • Monarch Napolйon Bonaparte becomes active

Back to top

170046. Genoa supports Louis XII

Action B of 174053 - The French King in Milan for Genoa
Action B of 174030 - The French King in Milan for Genoa

Description

In 1499 Louis XII invaded the Duchy of Milan asserting to be the legitimate heir and successor to Visconti according to his descent from Valentina Visconti, the daughter of Gian Galeazzo, first Duke of Milan and wife to his grand-father Louis I d'Orlйans. As soon as a combined attack in order to surround the duchy was driven by French and Venetian troops simultaneoulsy, town after town surrendered while the Milanese troops preferred to compromise with the enemy instead of fighting. The Milanese population, already adversed to Sforza because of his harsh taxation policy, rebelled forcing il Moro to escape with his family and treasure to Innsbruck at the court of his liege Maximilian, King of the Romans and Archduke of Austria. The French troops led by Gian Giacomo Trivulzio, entered the city of Milan without any resistance receiving a unexpected welcome by the population which Sforza had harshly taxed. Even the castle's garrison surrendered without any fight to the French invaders. Following the example of Milan and of other Lombard cities, also the Republic of Genoa, which Sforza had being ruling since 1488, swore allegiance to the new masters. Following the example of Milan and of other Lombard cities, also the Republic of Genoa, which had being waiting for the favourable moment and an ally strong enough to oppose Milanese interference in her domestic affairs, swore allegiance to the French King.

Actions

A. Great!

  • Gain an alliance with Genoa
  • +5 victory points

Back to top

170061. Margarete's dowry

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 179062 - Louis's Proposal for Austria
Action A of 137012 - Settlement at Arras for Burgundy

Description

A peace treaty was stipulated in Arras between Louis XI of France and the local governments of Burgundian Low Countries since Mary, Duchess of Burgundy had died a few months before. The Treaty arose primarily as a means with which to secure the Low Countries from Louis's claims, and thus preserve the stability and status of Duke Philippe's lowland inheritance. The Treaty formally rendered to Louis provinces in his realm that he had claimed at the outset of the war, and also recognized and reaffirmed Flandern as fief of France. In order to solidify a lasting peace, the Treaty pledged Mary's daughter, Margaret, to Louis's son and heir, Charles. Thus, Louis's acquisitions were, in light of the treaty, dowry for Margaret's marriage. Maximilian, of course, would have to agree to the marriage.

Actions

A. Accept the Treaty

  • Franche Comtй leaves the Holy Roman Empire
  • Cede Letzebuerg to Burgundy
  • Cede Brabant to Burgundy
  • Cede Holland to Burgundy
  • Cede Zeeland to Burgundy
  • Cede Breda to Burgundy
  • Cede Flandre to Burgundy
  • Cede Limburg to Burgundy
  • +75 relations with Burgundy
  • +25 relations with Austria
  • Gain a royal marriage with Burgundy

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 3149 - The Empire of France for France

Description

Napolйon aimed at the creation of an international Empire, in which the French innovative way of life would have spread out. The conquest of Europe much contributed to create the legendary figure of both a military Napolйon, leading his invincible Grand Armйe, and a political Napolйon, introducing important reforms and more efficient bureaucratic administrations in all the occupied or annexed territories. In return, those territories would provide the Emperor with money from locally levied taxes and with fresh 'voluntary' troops which would have followed him across Europe. The formation of a United Europe, le Grand Empire, by means of vassal states ruled by members of Bonaparte family was Napolйon's next and most ambitious goal.

170225. Nevers Denied

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action B of 220031 - Succession of Vincenzo II for Mantua

Description

With the passing of Duc Vincent II, war broke out between claimants Charles II - Duc de Mayenne and his cousin Ferrante II - Duc de Guastalla. Seeing it a chance to break Habsburg power in Italy, Cardinal et Duc de Richelieu convinced Louis XIII to support Mayenne and his father (Duc de Nevers) against Guastalla with his Habsburg allies Ferdinand II of Austria, Philippe IV of Spain and Charles Emmanuel I of Savoy. Relieving Nevers at Casale, Richelieu concluded the Peace of Susa with Savoy (Apr 1630). Peace of Regensburg (Oct 1630) confirmed Mayenne's rights with concessions to Savoy and Guastalla whilst reducing the Habsburg presence in Italy. However France couldn't 'meddle in affairs of the Empire' which induced Richelieu to continue fighting til the Treaty of Cherasco (1631) that gave France the strategically vital Pignerol (plus Pinerolo in secret by Victor-Amйdйe I of Savoy).

Actions

A. We will not be denied

  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Mantua for 36 months
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Spain for 36 months
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Austria for 36 months
  • Gain a temporary casus belli against Savoy for 36 months
  • -150 relations with Mantua
  • -150 relations with Spain
  • -100 relations with Austria
  • -100 relations with Savoy
  • +100 relations with Papal States
  • +100 relations with Venice
  • Gain an alliance with Papal States
  • Gain an alliance with Venice
  • Stability +2

170031. Nevers-Rethel inherits Cleves

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action C of 200103 - The Cleves succession for Cleves
Action B of 200102 - The Cleves succession for Cleves
Action C of 200101 - The Cleves succession for Cleves
Action C of 200107 - The Cleves succession for Cleves
Action C of 200106 - The Cleves succession for Cleves
Action D of 200105 - The Cleves succession for Cleves
Action B of 200104 - The Cleves succession for Cleves
Action B of 200108 - The Cleves succession for Cleves

Description

Duke Johann Wilhelm of Jьlich, Cleves and Berg died on March 25th 1609, in a state of complete insanity and without a child or brother. While in the United Duchies a woman could not succeed to the throne herself, succession through a female relative was possible. Hence the husbands of Johann Wilhelm's sisters claimed the inheritance. Duke Albrecht Friedrich of Prussia, married to the oldest sister Marie-Eleonore, had no male heir himself and ceded his claim to the husband of his daughter Anna, Elector Johann Sigismund of Brandenburg. This claim was questioned by the husband of the second sister Anna, Philipp Ludwig of Palatinate-Neuburg, who wanted the inheritance for his son Wolfgang Wilhelm. The Count of Nevers-Rethel, originally a sidebranch of the Cleves ducal dynasty, and the Elector of Saxony considered themselves legitimate heirs by virtue of several treaties, and the Emperor, desiring to expand the Habsburgs' supply base near the rebellious Netherlands,declared both female succession and the treaties invalid and was about to confiscate the United Duchies as a lapsed fief. Our vassal, the Count of Nevers-Rethel, has been acknowledged by the estates of the United Duchies as legitimate successor. This puts these territories into our sphere of influence.

Actions

A. How pleasant

  • Gain Cleves as vassals
  • Gain an alliance with Cleves
  • +100 relations with Cleves

Back to top

12108. Nobles response to the exile of the Parlement

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 12107 - Exile of the Parlement of Paris for France

Description

Nobles and high clergymen protested the exile of the Parlement vigorously. The provincial parlements backed up the Parlement of Paris, refusing to register tax after tax. The Parlement of Grenoble refused to register the new stamp and land taxes and even convoked its provincial Estates without royal authorization. Across France, the nobility revolted against the absolutism of the monarchy.

Actions

A. Tant pis (too bad)

  • Stability -3
  • Aristocracy +2
  • Global revolt risk +6 for 12 months

170239. Peace of Vervins

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 285277 - Peace of Vervins for Spain

Description

The Peace of Vervins was signed between the representatives of Henri IV of France and Felipe II of Spain on 2 May 1598, at the small town of Vervins. Henry had recently promulgated the Edict of Nantes, on 13 April. This treaty brought the Wars of Religion in France to a practical end. Felipe recognized the formerly Protestant Henri as King of France and withdrew his forces from the French territory they still occupied, depriving the remnants of the Catholic League of their support.

Actions

A. OK

  • +50 relations with Spain

170243. Pro-Genoese resistance in Corsica

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 174086 - The Marquis de Cursay in Corsica for Genoa

Description

When the French landed in 1748, the Genoese were in no position to oppose them. Moreover they still hoped that they would manage to quell the revolts like they had ten years earlier. Soon it became clear that the French commander was here to negotiate with the rebel leaders who were allowed some kind autonomy in the areas which they controlled. The French kept promising that they would leave but feeling that most of the population was friendly towards them and dreaded the return of the Genoese, they showed no sign of moving. The first incidents between French and pro-Genoese Corsicans happened near Sartй in November 1751. The next year, more serious fights opposed French and Genoese soldiers first in Bastia and then in other places as the newly appointed Genoese Comissar Giovanni Grimaldi was touring the island.

Actions

A. Darn!

  • Corsica revolts
  • Corsica revolts
  • Revolt risk value in Corsica +20
  • Stability -1

170177. Queen Margot

France — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 169002 - Queen Margot for Huguenots

Description

After almost a decade of turbulance and civil war between the Crown and the Huguenots, it seemed as if peace was within reach in the early 1570s. Catherine de Medici, concerned as always to bring about a religious reconcilation, proposed a marriage between her daughter Marguerite (called Margot) and the young Bourbon prince Henry of Navarre. The proposal divided the Huguenot leaders. At first both Henry's mother, the zealously Calvinist Jeanne d'Albret, and the Huguenots' military leader, Admiral Coligny were opposed to it. Coligny in particular preferred an alliance with England involving a marriage between Navarre and Elizabeth I. However, Jeanne died in June 1573 (thereby making Henry King of Navarre) while Coligny was gradually won over when he realised the marriage to Marguerite was necessary to achieve his plan for assisting his Dutch, coreligionists by making war on Spain.

Actions

A. Margot is married

  • +25 relations with Huguenots
  • Gain a royal marriage with Huguenots

Back to top
